function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Exposure to UV light at 253.7 nm can cause harm to unprotected skin and eyes.","Impact":"Skin and eye damage, including burns and potential long-term health effects.","Mitigation":"Implementing protective measures such as shields and barriers to prevent direct exposure to UV light.","Technologies":"UVGI fixtures with shielding to prevent direct exposure to UV light.","People":"Occupants of the room where UVGI fixtures are installed.","Owner":"Facility managers, building maintenance staff, and safety experts."},{"Description":"Ineffectiveness of UVGI fixtures in inactivating certain types of microorganisms.","Impact":"Risk of survival and propagation of specific microorganisms in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Regular assessment and maintenance of UVGI fixtures to ensure effectiveness, and consideration of alternative disinfection methods where needed.","Technologies":"UVGI effectiveness monitoring tools and alternative disinfection technologies.","People":"Facility managers, cleaning and maintenance staff, and infection control experts.","Owner":"Facility managers and building maintenance staff."},{"Description":"Dependence of UVGI efficacy on airflow conditions in the room.","Impact":"Inconsistent inactivation of microorganisms due to variations in airflow patterns.","Mitigation":"Optimizing room airflow and ventilation systems to ensure uniform exposure to UVGI and minimize dead zones.","Technologies":"Airflow monitoring and control systems, and UVGI fixtures with adjustable airflow features.","People":"HVAC engineers, facility managers, and building maintenance staff.","Owner":"HVAC engineers and facility managers."}]}
